resources.string: Enter a new name for your data set:
What would you like to do with this data set?

Your device does not have the proper Barcode Scanner application installed to use this feature. However, you may visit the Google Play store to download this application (\"Barcode Scanner\" by the Zxing Team).
Select which data sets you would like to upload to iSENSE. \n\t• Tap data sets to enable/disable them for upload. \n\t• Long press a data set to reconfigure it.
Are you sure you would like to delete all selected data sets? Selected data sets are the ones highlighted green.

Synchronizing time is useful when using multiple devices to record data at the same time. By default, many Android devices\' clocks will not match one another\'s, thus making recording data at similar times difficult. However, you have a choice to fix this issue by setting a device as a \"host\". This can be done by hitting the \"Send\" button. Upon hitting \"Send\", the time from that particular Android device will be broadcasted as a \"timeframe\" that all other phones in the local network can receive. However, in order for a phone to receive a broadcasted time, that phone must be currently in receive-mode, which can be done by hitting \"Receive\". In other words, if you intend on receiving a host\'s time, you must be in receive-mode before the host hits \"Send\". (By default, \"Send\" will also receive the time that you have broadcasted, should you be the host). After pressing either \"Send\" or \"Receive\", a dialog box will tell you the time that has been received from the host, along with the millisecond offset between the received time and your Android device\'s actual clock. If you do choose to synchronize time, recording data will now work off of the host\'s timeframe. This now allows for simultaneous data recording across multiple devices at the same time. Please note: synchronizing time will only work if all the Android devices are connected to the same WiFi network. Mobile plans (e.g. 3G or 4G) generally will not allow for synchronizing time. Also, synchronizing time may not be allowed on some WiFi networks, but it generally works on small, password-secured WiFi networks. Should you want to revert to your phone\'s local timestamp, you can use the \"Reset\" button.
Failed to synchronize time. You may try again.

One or more of the data sets you have selected to upload have no associated project. This is indicated by the text that states \"No Project\" with each associated data set. In order to upload these data sets, press and hold the data sets with no associated project and select \"Select Project\" to associate the data set with a project.
Match the project\'s fields (left) with fields that this app can record data for (dropdowns on the right). If no match is available, leave the drop down blank.
Always prompt for first name and last initial
Select a field type from the drop down menu below to add a new field to your project.
Please enter a new project name
Please enter at least one field for your project
Please enter a name for field #
Cannot add more than one location
Cannot add more than one timestamp
Project failed to create - please try again
A contributor key allows you to contribute data to a specific project without an iSense account.
